subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 28 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Derby 1-0 West Brom
Stephen Pearson scores the only goal as Derby win the Championship play-off final to secure a place in next season's Premiership.



 
Davies delights as Rams cash in
Derby boss Billy Davies looks forward to pitting his wits against the Premiership elite.



 
Keane signs new deal at Tottenham
Tottenham striker Robbie Keane commits himself to the club for another five years.








GOLF




Rose pulls out of Memorial event
England's Justin Rose pulls out of this week's Memorial Tournament in America.



 
Dredge eyes home Wales Open win
Bradley Dredge is on a quest to become the first home winner of the Celtic Manor Wales Open.



 
Hansen snatches victory from Rose
Anders Hansen edges a sudden-death play-off with Justin Rose to win the PGA Championship at Wentworth.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.



 
McLaren deny anti-Hamilton bias
McLaren say Lewis Hamilton is free to race team-mate Fernando Alonso despite imposing team orders at the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Scot Franchitti clinches Indy 500
Scotland's Dario Franchitti wins the Indianapolis 500 in front of 350,000 fans.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren deny anti-Hamilton bias
McLaren say Lewis Hamilton is free to race team-mate Fernando Alonso despite imposing team orders at the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Alonso puts Hamilton in his place
Fernando Alonso beats McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton to win the Monaco Grand Prix and retake the championship lead.



 
As it happened: Monaco Grand Prix
Fernando Alonso triumphs for McLaren at the Monaco Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Disgraced Chambers in drugs claim
Dwain Chambers claims there will always be athletes using performance-enhancing drugs because the scientists will remain one step ahead of the testers.



 
Sotherton javelin costs her dear
Another woeful performance with the javelin sees Kelly Sotherton finish seventh in her first
heptathlon competition of the season.



 
Okoro wins 800m race in Holland
Marilyn Okoro clinches a thrilling 800m victory at the Thales FBK-Games in Hengelo, Holland.








CYCLING




Ricco toils to mountain stage win
Saunier Duval rider Riccardo Ricco wins the gruelling 15th stage of the Tour of Italy.



 
Zabel admits to doping at Telekom
German cyclist Erik Zabel becomes the latest cyclist to admit to using banned blood booster EPO while competing for Telekom in the 1990s.



 
Landis hearing brought to an end
Floyd Landis's doping hearing ends on Wednesday after nine days of legal arguments and dramatic testimony.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Graham Poll gets his air guitar out as the Liverpool parade bus stays in the garage



 
Farewell West Jesmond
BBC Sport's adopted team look back on their season



 
Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock
